trans-unit.source: This topic and its sub-topics provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic and its sub-topics provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="c90a5779-eefe-473a-acfa-40934b50d0cc" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Pipelines and Activities</link> for the latest JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="c90a5779-eefe-473a-acfa-40934b50d0cc" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Pipelines and Activities</link> for the latest JSON format.

trans-unit.source: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: The top level structure of the pipeline JSON is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The top level structure of the pipeline JSON is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Within the square brackets ([ ]), there can be one or more activities defined with each activity having the following top-level structure.
trans-unit.target: Within the square brackets ([ ]), there can be one or more activities defined with each activity having the following top-level structure.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the tags within the Activity JSON:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the tags within the Activity JSON:

trans-unit.source: Specify a name that represents the action that the activity is configured to do.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name that represents the action that the activity is configured to do.

trans-unit.source: Text describing what the activity is used for.
trans-unit.target: Text describing what the activity is used for.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of the activity.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of the activity.

trans-unit.source: Input tables used by the activity.
trans-unit.target: Input tables used by the activity.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0ccbc223-a448-441d-8b2e-90bd937c777e#InputAndOutputTables" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Input and output tables</link> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0ccbc223-a448-441d-8b2e-90bd937c777e#InputAndOutputTables" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Input and output tables</link> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Output tables used by the activity.
trans-unit.target: Output tables used by the activity.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0ccbc223-a448-441d-8b2e-90bd937c777e#InputAndOutputTables" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Input and output tables</link> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0ccbc223-a448-441d-8b2e-90bd937c777e#InputAndOutputTables" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Input and output tables</link> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Name of the linked service used by the activity.
trans-unit.target: Name of the linked service used by the activity.

trans-unit.source: For example, the HDInsight activity requires that you specify the linked service that links to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For example, the HDInsight activity requires that you specify the linked service that links to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to specify the linkedServiceName when using Copy Activity.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to specify the linkedServiceName when using Copy Activity.

trans-unit.source: Yes (HDInsight Activity, Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity)
trans-unit.target: Yes (HDInsight Activity, Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity)

trans-unit.source: Properties in the transformation depend on type (example: CopyActivity or HDInsightActivity).
trans-unit.target: Properties in the transformation depend on type (example: CopyActivity or HDInsightActivity).

trans-unit.source: See the topics listed in <link xlink:href="0ccbc223-a448-441d-8b2e-90bd937c777e#InThisSection" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">In This Section</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See the topics listed in <link xlink:href="0ccbc223-a448-441d-8b2e-90bd937c777e#InThisSection" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">In This Section</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Policies which affect the run-time behavior of the activity.
trans-unit.target: Policies which affect the run-time behavior of the activity.

trans-unit.source: If it is not specified, default policies will be used.
trans-unit.target: If it is not specified, default policies will be used.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>start</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>end</embeddedLabel> properties together specify active period for the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>start</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>end</embeddedLabel> properties together specify active period for the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Output slices are only produced with in this active period.
trans-unit.target: Output slices are only produced with in this active period.

trans-unit.source: You can set active period for a pipeline using the <embeddedLabel>Set-AzureDataFactoryPipelineActivePeriod</embeddedLabel> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can set active period for a pipeline using the <embeddedLabel>Set-AzureDataFactoryPipelineActivePeriod</embeddedLabel> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> property has different value for each activity allowed in a pipeline by the Azure Data Factory service.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> property has different value for each activity allowed in a pipeline by the Azure Data Factory service.

trans-unit.source: A pipeline can have one or more activities.
trans-unit.target: A pipeline can have one or more activities.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides the details.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides the details.

trans-unit.source: Copies the data from a data store to another data store.
trans-unit.target: Copies the data from a data store to another data store.

trans-unit.source: The store can be either a cloud or on-premises store.
trans-unit.target: The store can be either a cloud or on-premises store.

trans-unit.source: This activity supports three types of transformations:
trans-unit.target: This activity supports three types of transformations:

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Pig script that will process the data from the input tables, and produce data to output tables.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Pig script that will process the data from the input tables, and produce data to output tables.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Hive script that will process the data from the input tables, and produce data to output tables.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Hive script that will process the data from the input tables, and produce data to output tables.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the MapReduce program that will be invoked to process the data from the input tables, and produce data to the output tables.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the MapReduce program that will be invoked to process the data from the input tables, and produce data to the output tables.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity

trans-unit.source: This activity gets the location of the input file from your input tables, call the Azure Machine Learning batch scoring API, and copy the batch scoring output to the blob given in your output table.
trans-unit.target: This activity gets the location of the input file from your input tables, call the Azure Machine Learning batch scoring API, and copy the batch scoring output to the blob given in your output table.

trans-unit.source: This activity invokes a stored procedure in an Azure SQL Database when the input data is ready and produces output as per the schedule defined by the output table.
trans-unit.target: This activity invokes a stored procedure in an Azure SQL Database when the input data is ready and produces output as per the schedule defined by the output table.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for specifying inputs and outputs in JSON is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The syntax for specifying inputs and outputs in JSON is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The number of <embeddedLabel>inputs</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>outputs</embeddedLabel> differ for each activity.
trans-unit.target: The number of <embeddedLabel>inputs</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>outputs</embeddedLabel> differ for each activity.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Batch Scoring Activity

trans-unit.source: If you specify multiple output tables for an activity, the tables must be on the same schedule.
trans-unit.target: If you specify multiple output tables for an activity, the tables must be on the same schedule.

trans-unit.source: You can specify policies for an activity that affect the run-time behavior, specifically when the slice of a table is processed.
trans-unit.target: You can specify policies for an activity that affect the run-time behavior, specifically when the slice of a table is processed.

trans-unit.source: Number of concurrent executions of the activity.
trans-unit.target: Number of concurrent executions of the activity.

trans-unit.source: It determines the number of parallel activity executions that can happen on different slices.
trans-unit.target: It determines the number of parallel activity executions that can happen on different slices.

trans-unit.source: For example, if an activity needs to go through a large set of available data, having a larger concurrency speeds up the data processing.
trans-unit.target: For example, if an activity needs to go through a large set of available data, having a larger concurrency speeds up the data processing.

trans-unit.source: Determines the ordering of data slices that is processed.
trans-unit.target: Determines the ordering of data slices that is processed.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have 2 slices (one happening at 4pm, and another one at 5pm), and both are pending execution.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have 2 slices (one happening at 4pm, and another one at 5pm), and both are pending execution.

trans-unit.source: If you set the executionPriorityOrder to be NewestFirst, the slice at 5pm will be processed first.
trans-unit.target: If you set the executionPriorityOrder to be NewestFirst, the slice at 5pm will be processed first.

trans-unit.source: Similarly if you set the executionPriorityORder to be OldestFIrst, then the slice at 4pm will be processed.
trans-unit.target: Similarly if you set the executionPriorityORder to be OldestFIrst, then the slice at 4pm will be processed.

trans-unit.source: Number of retries before the data processing for the slice is marked as Failure.
trans-unit.target: Number of retries before the data processing for the slice is marked as Failure.

trans-unit.source: Activity execution for a data slice is retried up to the specified retry count.
trans-unit.target: Activity execution for a data slice is retried up to the specified retry count.

trans-unit.source: The retry is done as soon as possible after the failure.
trans-unit.target: The retry is done as soon as possible after the failure.

trans-unit.source: If a value is not specified or is 0, the timeout is infinite.
trans-unit.target: If a value is not specified or is 0, the timeout is infinite.

trans-unit.source: If the data processing time on a slice exceeds the timeout value, it is canceled, and the system attempts to retry the processing.
trans-unit.target: If the data processing time on a slice exceeds the timeout value, it is canceled, and the system attempts to retry the processing.

trans-unit.source: The number of retries depends on the retry property.
trans-unit.target: The number of retries depends on the retry property.

trans-unit.source: When timeout occurs, the status will be TimedOut.
trans-unit.target: When timeout occurs, the status will be TimedOut.

trans-unit.source: Specify the delay before data processing of the slice starts.
trans-unit.target: Specify the delay before data processing of the slice starts.

trans-unit.source: The execution of activity for a data slice is started after the Delay is past the expected execution time.
trans-unit.target: The execution of activity for a data slice is started after the Delay is past the expected execution time.

trans-unit.source: The number of long retry attempts before the slice execution is failed.
trans-unit.target: The number of long retry attempts before the slice execution is failed.

trans-unit.source: LongRetry attempts are spaced by LongRetryInterval.
trans-unit.target: LongRetry attempts are spaced by LongRetryInterval.

trans-unit.source: So if you need to specify a time between retry attempts, use LongRetry.
trans-unit.target: So if you need to specify a time between retry attempts, use LongRetry.

trans-unit.source: If both Retry and LongRetry are specified, each LongRetry attempt will include Retry attempts and the max number of attempts will be Retry * LongRetry.
trans-unit.target: If both Retry and LongRetry are specified, each LongRetry attempt will include Retry attempts and the max number of attempts will be Retry * LongRetry.

trans-unit.source: For example, if we have the following in activity policy:
trans-unit.target: For example, if we have the following in activity policy:

trans-unit.source: If there is only one slice to execute (status is PendingExecution), and activity execution fails every time, there would be 3 (Retry) consecutive execution attempts.
trans-unit.target: If there is only one slice to execute (status is PendingExecution), and activity execution fails every time, there would be 3 (Retry) consecutive execution attempts.

trans-unit.source: After each attempt the slice status would be Retry.
trans-unit.target: After each attempt the slice status would be Retry.

trans-unit.source: Then the slice status would be LongRetry.
trans-unit.target: Then the slice status would be LongRetry.

trans-unit.source: After 1 hour (LongRetryInteval), there would be another set of 3 (Retry) consecutive execution attempts.
trans-unit.target: After 1 hour (LongRetryInteval), there would be another set of 3 (Retry) consecutive execution attempts.

trans-unit.source: After that, the slice status would be Failed and no more retries would be attempted.
trans-unit.target: After that, the slice status would be Failed and no more retries would be attempted.

trans-unit.source: This means we retried 6 times total (3*2).
trans-unit.target: This means we retried 6 times total (3*2).

trans-unit.source: Obviously, if any execution succeeds, the slice status would be Ready and no more retries will be attempted.
trans-unit.target: Obviously, if any execution succeeds, the slice status would be Ready and no more retries will be attempted.

trans-unit.source: The delay between long retry attempts.
trans-unit.target: The delay between long retry attempts.
